sn50.1-12:1.3: The powers of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
sn50.1-12:1.5: The Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn50.1-12:1.6: In the same way, a mendicant who develops and cultivates the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn50.1-12:1.7: And how does a mendicant who develops the five powers slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?
sn50.1-12:1.8: It’s when a mendicant develops the powers of faith,
sn50.1-12:1.12: and wisdom, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn50.1-12:1.13: That’s how a mendicant who develops and cultivates the five powers slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
sn50.1-12:1.15: (To be expanded for each of the different rivers as in SN 45.91–102.)
sn50.1-12:2.1: Six on slanting to the east,
sn50.1-12:2.2: and six on slanting to the ocean;
sn50.1-12:2.4: and that’s how this chapter is recited.
